New Records: Wyatt Langford became the first Rangers rookie to hit a walk-off grand slam in a 7-4 win over the Yankees and Holmes.
Key Match Events: Wyatt Langford hit a game-ending grand slam off All-Star closer Clay Holmes in the bottom of the 9th inning.
Ji-Man Jung homered to left center in the 4th inning, scoring two runs.
Ji-Man Jung singled to center in the 8th inning, scoring two more runs.
Nate Lowe hit a sacrifice fly to center in the 8th inning, scoring a run.
Post-Match Reflections: The Texas Rangers secured a 2-1 series lead with their win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas, with 29,356 attendees.
